name: More Marvel Madness Quiz | Comics | 15 Questions

questions.text: Which Avenger once planned to take benevolent control of the world government?
questions.explanation:
Vision.

	When it was learned that the Vision planned to take benevolent control of the world government, certain punitive measures were taken by the United States, despite the fact that the Vision aborted his plan before it truly endangered anyone. The government limited the Avengers' access to security-related information and revoked certain sanctions, including the privilege of launching their supersonic Quinjets from their Mansion.

questions.text: What is the name of the mutant (self-titled angel of death) who has revealed herself twice to Archangel when he was near death?
questions.explanation:
Amalgam.

	The being known as Amalgam has the ability to absorb the powers and memories of mutants, and sees herself as housing the re-creations of the mutants she absorbs. The Amalgam appeared twice to the mutant known as Archangel. The first time when the hero, then simply Angel, had a near-death experience at the hands of the mutant-killing Marauders during the so-called Mutant Massacre. The second time when Archangel was shot nearly to death by mutant terrorists wearing Mandroid armor.

questions.text: Who was the being Puma (Thomas Fireheart) created to kill?
questions.explanation:
Beyonder.

	Throughout its history, the American Indian tribe to which Thomas Fireheart belongs has maintained legends foretelling the coming of a being of infinite power who would pose a tremendous threat to the entire world. Puma was contacted by his uncle the shaman of their tribe. The shaman announced that the threat for which Puma spent his life in training had arrived on Earth. The being of infinite power was identified as The Beyonder.

questions.text: How did Avenger Janet Van Dyne (Wasp) get her powers?
questions.explanation:
Pym Particles.

	Janet Van Dyne is able to shrink down to insect-size, due to her exposure to Pym particles. Originally, she used pills or gas canisters to control her size-alteration, but now she is able to control it at will.

questions.text: Which of the following people was NEVER known as Captain America?
questions.explanation:
William Baker.

	In 1945, right before the end of the war, the original Captain America and Bucky disappeared. President Harry S. Truman asked William Nasland to become Captain America. When Steve Rogers gave up his Captain America identity due to governmental pressure, the government, an agency known as the Commission, hired John F, Walker to take his place, even training him. The man known as the Grand Director changed his name to Steven Rogers after he found a copy of the Super-soldier serum, he injected himself with the serum and became Captain America IV. William Baker is The Sandman.

questions.text: What famous TV talk show host helped Wonder Man and the Avengers defeat Tha Maleviolet-Mechno Marader?
questions.explanation:
David Letterman.

	At one point, the hero Wonder Man called up several of his teammates from the hero team Avengers to go on Late Night with David Letterman with him, so Wonder Man could get on TV to help his movie career. The Maleviolet Mechno-Marader (Fabian Stankowicz) saw that the Avengers were going on the Late Show, and he snuck in and attacked the Avengers with a machanical machine which the Avengers easily destoryed. Letterman took his big doorknob and hit the Maleviolet Mechno-Marader on the head and knocked him out cold.

questions.text: Walter Langkowski (Sasquatch) of the team Alpha Flight thought he gained his powers due to Gamma radiation exposure, but was actually transforming into one of the Mythical Great Beasts. What is the Name of the Great Beast he inhabits?
questions.explanation:
Tanaraq.

	Langkowski was wrong in believing that he had gained his Sasquatch form from gamma radiation. The equipment he used in the experiment in the Arctic laboratory had actually unleashed for a fraction of a second enough physical energy to sunder the mystical barrier separating Earth from the otherdimensional realm of the Great Beasts, enemies of the gods of native Canadian mythology. A mystic link was formed between Langkowski and the Great Beast called Tanaraq, enabling Langkowski, without knowing what he was really doing, to take on Tanaraq's form and control it.

questions.text: What is the name of the 150ft. long dragon that Iron Man slaps around occasionally?
questions.explanation:
Fin Fang Foom.

	Fin Fang Foom is a gigantic dragon, approximately 15 stories tall whose origin is unknown but who is known to have lived in ancient China.

questions.text: What is Mojo's personal pack of bounty hunters/peace officers known as?
questions.explanation:
War Wolves.

	The Warwolves are a pack of six wolf-like creatures artificially created in the dimension known as the "Mojoverse," presumably in order to serve as bounty hunters/peace officers.

questions.text: The Maggia is the world's most powerful criminal organization, with a hand in most drug traffic, illegal gambling, extortion rackets and other illegal activities in the United States. Which of the following is NOT one of the Maggia's crime families?
questions.explanation:
The Zemo Family.

	Hammerhead Family:The first American Maggia family gained prominence when the leader, referred to as the "Top Man," outfitted his family hit man with costumes and advanced weaponry. Silvermane Family:This section of the Maggia conducts matters along the traditional lines with its chief activity being in the narcotics trade.Nafaria Family:This is the most eccentric family in the Maggia. The deceased Italian nobleman, Count Luchino Nefaria, a scientific genius, was the world's most powerful Maggia leader until his first defeat at the hands of the hero team Avengers.

questions.text: T or F? The second man known as War Machine real name is Percy Johnson?
questions.explanation:
False.

	The second War Machine true identity is Parnell Jacobs.

questions.text: What task did Daniel Thomas Rand have to complete to receive the power of the Iron fist?
questions.correct: Slaying the dragon Shou-Lao the Undying.
options: Discover the mystical doorway to K'un-Lun.
Beat the best warrior from K'un-Lun in battle
Kill Harold Meachum, the man who killed his father.
questions.explanation:
Slaying the dragon Shou-Lao the Undying.

	In K'un-Lun, Daniel trained rigorously in the martial arts. On his 19th birthday, he earned the opportunity to possess the power of the Iron Fist by slaying the dragon Shou-Lao the Undying.

questions.text: What was the name of the agency owned by Prince Namor that helped fund Power Man and Iron Fist's Hero For Hire exploits?
questions.explanation:
Oracle Inc.

	Following the seeming deaths of most of Earth's heroes at the hands of the sentient psionic menace known as Onslaught, the duo decided to expand the membership of Heroes for Hire. The agency merged with Oracle Inc. -- the corporation owned by Prince Namor, the Atlantean Sub-Mariner -- to protect the world from danger...for a price.

questions.text: Who is responsible for the creation of the Sentinels?
questions.explanation:
Bolivar Trask.

	The Sentinels are large, semi-humanoid androids tasked with the annihilation of mutantkind. Created by former NASA engineer Bolivar Trask.

questions.text: The creation of what super villian made the Beyonder aware of the existance of other sentient beings besides himself?
questions.explanation:
Molecule Man.

	The Beyonder was entirely unaware of the existence of other beings until a laboratory accident transformed lowly worker Owen Reece into the superhuman "Molecule Man," which opened up a pinhole between the Beyond-Realm and the multiverse which Earth exists.
